I saw that the great condescension for man has been made. Jesus condescended to the shameful death of the cross, and now man in his turn must condescend and bow. He must yield up his will and pleasure if he would follow in the only road to heaven. I saw that God would not compel any to be saved. Jesus has made the great sacrifice, and if man will 
                                                                           279
freely, gladly accept it; if he will choose life, he can have it. But his life must be one of continual yielding.
